attributes.action: Home Office to reconsider the start date of the New Graduate Programme
attributes.additional_details:
Students have been left in limbo with little or not time to obtain further admissions, employment  or chance to extend their visas. 
The Home Office had ample time since the announcement in September  2019 to set a start date but has remained silent. Thousands of students have come to the UK as a result of the announcement , despite the Home Office citing the fact that current students had no expectation of being able to work after their course when they started.
attributes.background: The New Graduate Programme will be starting on the 1st July 2021, but the Home Office has shown no sympathy to those graduating before. Students have been left in limbo with little or not time to obtain further admissions, employment  or chance to extend their visas.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Extend the 2 years post-study work visas to 2020 Graduates: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571665

Extend new Graduate Route to 2020 and pre-July 2021 graduates: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578675
